sections.About: The course comprises lectures, and classes with exercises and discussions. Probability theory is a rich and varied area of mathematics, with many applications; modern statistics is based on this theory. The purpose of this course is to study its foundations. Key words and phrases are: basics, moments, independence and conditioning, the strong law of large numbers, transforms and the central limit theorem, random walk and the Markov property.
sections.Entry requirements: Completed course containing basic probability theory, such as MSG110 Probability theory.
sections.Selection: All eligible applicants who have applied before the deadline will be granted a place.
